Privacy Policy

1. Data Controller

The data controller responsible for processing your personal data is:

  • Company: SESEC
  • Activity: Cybersecurity Consulting
  • Address: Spain
  • Email: privacy@sesecpro.com
  • Phone: +34 XXX XXX XXX
  • Website: www.sesecpro.com

2. Data We Collect

2.1 Contact Information

When you contact us through our forms or email, we may collect:

  • Name and surname
  • Email address
  • Phone number
  • Company name
  • Message content

2.2 Technical Information

When you visit our website, we automatically collect:

  • IP address
  • Browser type and version
  • Operating system
  • Pages visited and time spent
  • Referral source

3. Purpose of Processing

We process your personal data for the following purposes:

3.1 Service Provision

  • Respond to your inquiries and requests
  • Provide cybersecurity consulting services
  • Maintain customer relationships
  • Process service contracts

3.2 Website Improvement

  • Analyze website usage and performance
  • Improve user experience
  • Ensure website security

3.3 Legal Compliance

  • Comply with legal obligations
  • Maintain accounting records
  • Handle legal claims

4. Legal Basis

The legal basis for processing your data depends on the purpose:

  • Consent: When you voluntarily provide information through forms
  • Contractual necessity: To fulfill service agreements
  • Legitimate interest: For website analytics and security
  • Legal obligation: To comply with applicable laws

5. Data Retention

We retain your personal data for the following periods:

  • Contact inquiries: 2 years from last contact
  • Service contracts: 6 years after contract termination
  • Website analytics: 26 months maximum
  • Legal obligations: As required by applicable law

6. Your Rights

Under the GDPR, you have the following rights:

6.1 Access and Portability

  • Right to access your personal data
  • Right to data portability

6.2 Correction and Deletion

  • Right to rectify inaccurate data
  • Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten")

6.3 Processing Limitations

  • Right to restrict processing
  • Right to object to processing
  • Right to withdraw consent

To exercise these rights, contact us at: privacy@sesecpro.com

7. Data Security

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data:

  • Encryption of data in transit and at rest
  • Access controls and authentication
  • Regular security assessments
  • Staff training on data protection
  • Incident response procedures

8. Data Sharing

We do not sell your personal data. We may share data with:

8.1 Service Providers

  • Cloud hosting providers
  • Email service providers
  • Analytics services

8.2 Legal Requirements

  • Law enforcement agencies (when legally required)
  • Regulatory authorities
  • Courts and legal proceedings

9. International Transfers

If we transfer your data outside the EU, we ensure adequate protection through:

  • Adequacy decisions by the European Commission
  • Standard Contractual Clauses
  • Binding Corporate Rules
  • Certification schemes

10. Cookies

Our website uses cookies as described in our Cookie Policy. You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings.

11. Updates

We may update this privacy policy periodically. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date.

12. Supervisory Authority

You have the right to lodge a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Agency (AEPD) if you believe your rights have been violated:

  • Website: www.aepd.es
  • Address: C/ Jorge Juan, 6, 28001 Madrid, Spain

13. Contact

For any questions about this privacy policy or data protection:

  • Email: privacy@sesecpro.com
  • Phone: +34 XXX XXX XXX
  • Address: Spain
